column1: What is the central theme of Chapter 5, "Governing The Goldmine"?
column2: It provides a framework for managing the tension between velocity and control in data governance.

column1: What are the two primary sections of the chapter's strategy, titled "The Strategy: Speed + Control"?
column2: The Agile Data Governance Matrix and the concept of Gatekeepers vs. Guardrails.

column1: What specific path does "The Agile Data Governance Matrix" aim to map?
column2: The path from a "Data Swamp" to an "Agile Bank."

column1: The governance model of "Gatekeepers vs. Guardrails" advocates for a move away from what practice?
column2: It advocates moving away from manual sign-offs.

column1: According to the source, what is the primary negative consequence of using manual sign-offs for governance?
column2: They slow down the process.

column1: The "Gatekeepers vs. Guardrails" model promotes the adoption of what alternative to manual sign-offs?
column2: It promotes the adoption of automated code checks.

column1: What is the stated benefit of using automated code checks for governance?
column2: They keep the process and data safe.

column1: The governance strategy should move from manual sign-offs (which slow us down) to _____ (which keep us safe).
column2: automated code checks

column1: What is the title of the second major section in the chapter outline, focusing on practical application?
column2: The Execution: Governance in Motion.

column1: What is the core principle of implementing "Just-in-Time" Governance?
column2: Fixing data errors at the source, not downstream.

column1: Concept: "Just-in-Time" Governance
column2: An execution strategy focused on addressing and correcting data errors at their point of origin rather than later in the data pipeline.

column1: What specific challenge does "The Shadow IT Trap" address?
column2: How to govern the sprawl of "credit card" software.

column1: What is the crucial balance that must be maintained when addressing the "Shadow IT Trap"?
column2: Governing software sprawl without killing innovation.

column1: What is the title of the third major section in the chapter outline, which proposes a final approach?
column2: The Solution: Data as a Product.

column1: What is the fundamental idea behind the "Data as a Product" solution?
column2: Treating internal data assets with the same rigor as customer-facing apps.

column1: The solution of treating internal data assets with the same rigor as customer-facing apps is known as _____.
column2: Data as a Product

column1: What specific tool is introduced to support the "Data as a Product" methodology?
column2: The Data Product Canvas.

column1: What new role is created to manage data within the "Data as a Product" framework?
column2: The Data Product Owner.

column1: In the "Data as a Product" model, what concept is referred to as "The Guarantee"?
column2: Defining Service Level Objectives (SLOs).

column1: What is the ultimate purpose of defining Service Level Objectives (SLOs) for data products?
column2: To create trust in the data.

column1: What is the main takeaway message summarized in the "IF YOU REMEMBER NOTHING ELSE" section?
column2: Governance is an Accelerator, Not a Brake.
